text_paragraphs: Information Note on the Court’s case-law No.
February 1991
Pugliese v. Italy (no. 1) - 11840/85
Judgment 19.2.1991
Article 6
Article 6-1
Reasonable time
Length of criminal proceedings: violation

[This summary is extracted from the Court’s official reports (Series A or Reports of Judgments and Decisions). Its formatting and structure may therefore differ from the Case-Law Information Note summaries.]
I.	ARTICLE 6 § 1 OF THE CONVENTION ("reasonable time")
A.	Period to be taken into consideration
Starting-point: date on which judicial notification was sent to applicant.
Close: pronouncement of amnesty by District Court.
Total: more than five years and two months.
B.	Applicable criteria
Reasonableness of length of proceedings: to be assessed in the light of the particular circumstances of the case, which in this instance called for overall assessment.
Case not a complex one and applicant caused hardly any delay – long periods of stagnation at first instance and on appeal attributable to competent authorities.
Conclusion: violation (unanimously).
II.	ARTICLE 50 OF THE CONVENTION
Non-pecuniary damage: finding of a violation sufficient satisfaction.
Conclusion: judgment constituted in itself sufficient just satisfaction (unanimously).
